startInteraction: ^In the quiet corner of Katrinebjerg, you notice a student hunched over textbooks, looking visibly exhausted.
^. I'm just trying to survive these semesters."

s: ^"Surviving semesters can be tough. Need any help or advice?"

inquireAboutWellBeing: ^The Weary Student lets out a tired sigh. "Exhausted is an understatement,
^. These semesters are draining, and I'm barely keeping up."

s: ^"I can relate. It's a tough journey. Anything specific on your mind?"
^"Hang in there. It'll get better. Anything I can do to help?"

offerAssistance: ^The Weary Student looks up, appreciating the concern. "Thanks,
^. It's just a rough patch. Trying to push through."

s: ^"If you ever need someone to talk to or share the load, I'm here."
^"Don't hesitate to ask for help. We're all in this together."

listenToConcerns: ^The Weary Student opens up, "It's the constant pressure, deadlines, and the fear of falling behind. Just overwhelmed, you know?"

s: ^"I completely understand. Sometimes it helps to share the load. You're not alone in this."
^"Have you considered talking to a mentor or seeking academic support?"

offerHelpToTiredStudent: ^The Weary Student manages a weak smile. "I appreciate it,
^. It's just the fatigue catching up. A bit of encouragement goes a long way."

s: ^"Take a break when you can. You've earned it. If there's anything specific I can do, let me know."
^"We all need support. Don't hesitate to ask for help when needed."

offerListeningEar: ^. It feels good to talk about it. Sometimes it's just nice to know someone understands."

s: ^"Anytime you need to vent or discuss things, I'm here. We're all in this together."

encourageToSeekHelp: ^. I haven't really thought about that. Maybe seeking some help would make a difference."

s: ^"It's worth considering. There's no shame in reaching out for support. We all need it at times."

suggestSeekingHelp: ^"It might be beneficial to seek help,
^. Whether it's talking to a mentor, reaching out to academic support, or just finding someone to share the burden with, seeking help can make a significant difference."

s: ^"I'll consider that. Thanks for the advice."
^"You're right. I'll look into finding support. Appreciate your suggestion."

offerSpecificHelp: ^The Weary Student nods appreciatively. "A break sounds amazing. Maybe I'll do that. Thanks for the reminder,

s: ^"Take your time. If you need assistance with anything specific, feel free to ask. We're all here to help each other."
